sen.j: 豊道春海（ぶんどう しゅんかい、1878年9月1日 - 1970年9月26日）は、大正期から昭和にかけての天台宗の僧。
sen.e: Bundo Shunkai (September 1, 1878-September 26, 1970) was a priest of Tendai Sect from the Taisho to Showa period.
Bundo Shunkai (September 1, 1878-September 26, 1970) was a priest of the Tendai sect from the Taisho to Showa period.
BUNDO Shunkai (September 1, 1878-September 26, 1970) was a priest of the Tendai sect from the Taisho to Showa period.
sen.cmt: 豊道春海Bundo Shunkai を BUNDO Shunkai に修正しました。用語集では Bundo Shunkai となっておりましたが、以下のページで BUNDO Shunkai という定訳を見つけました。統一リストの指示という観点からもこちらの方が適切と思われましたため、この表記に従わせていただきました。http://search.artmuseums.go.jp/records.php?sakuhin=35

sen.e: He was a calligrapher.
He was a calligrapher.
He was a calligrapher.

sen.j: 本名は慶中（けいちゅう）。
sen.e: His real name was Keichu.
His real name was Keichu.
His real name was Keichu.

sen.j: 別号は龍渓、谷門道人、天門海翁。
sen.e: Pseudonym were Ryukei, Yamondojin and Tenmonkaio.
sen.cmt: 「谷門道人」「天門海翁」は、用語衆には記載無く、サイトで検索しましたが見つからず、読み方不明のまま、とりあえず仮に記入いたしました。「龍渓」は、用語集の別の人物の名前から引用しました。
sen.e: Pseudonyms he had were Ryukei, Yamondojin and Tenmonkaio.
Pseudonyms he had were Ryukei, Yamondojin and Tenmonkaio.
His childhood name was Torakichi Kawakami.
His childhood name was Torakichi Kawakami.
His childhood name was Torakichi KAWAKAMI.
sen.cmt: Kawakami を KAWAKAMI に修正しました。

sen.e: He came from Tochigi Prefecture.
He was originally from the Tochigi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Lengthened the sentence a bit to reduce sentence fragmentation
sen.e: He was originally from the Tochigi Prefecture.

sen.j: 六歳で僧籍に入り、1890年東京浅草華徳院住職となる。
sen.e: He was formally entered as a monk in the registry of a sect of Buddhism at the age of six and in 1890 became chief priest of Katoku-in Temple in Asakusa, Tokyo.
Bundo Shunkai formerly entered the priesthood in the registry of a Buddhism sect at the age of six, and in 1890 became the chief priest of Katoku-in Temple in Asakusa, Tokyo.
sen.cmt: Changed "He" to his name since this is the beginning of a paragraph; "as a monk"→"the priesthood"
sen.e: BUNDO Shunkai formerly entered the priesthood in the registry of a Buddhism sect at the age of six, and in 1890 became the chief priest of Katoku-in Temple in Asakusa, Tokyo.
sen.cmt: Bundo Shunkai を BUNDO Shunkai に修正しました。

sen.j: 91年より書を西川春洞に学んで、六朝風の楷書に独自の書風を作り出した。
sen.e: He started to learn calligraphy under Shundo NISHIKAWA in 1891 and created his own calligraphic style of Rikucho-style Chinese characters.
He started learning calligraphy under Shundo NISHIKAWA in 1891 and created his own calligraphic style of Rikucho-style Chinese characters.
sen.cmt: "He started to learn calligraphy"→"He started learning calligraphy"
sen.e: He started learning calligraphy under Shundo NISHIKAWA in 1891 and created his own calligraphic style of Rikucho-style Chinese characters.

sen.j: 1914年東京大正博覧会で千字文が銀牌となる。
sen.e: He received the silver award for his Senjimon (a poem consisting of one thousand Chinese characters) at the Tokyo Taisho Exposition in 1914.
He received the silver award for his Senjimon (a poem consisting of one thousand Chinese characters) at the Tokyo Taisho Exposition in 1914.
He received the silver award for his Senjimon (a poem consisting of one thousand Chinese characters) at the Tokyo Taisho Exposition in 1914.

sen.j: 同年瑞雲書道会を主宰、1930年〈昭和5年）に泰東書道院を設立した。
sen.e: In the same year, he was at the helm of the Zuiun Shodokai (a contest for top level calligraphy instructors throughout Japan) and in 1930 established the Taito Shodoin.
In the same year, he was at the helm of the Zuiun Shodokai (a contest for top level calligraphy instructors throughout Japan), and in 1930 established the Taito Shodoin.
In the same year, he was at the helm of the Zuiun Shodokai (a contest for top level calligraphy instructors throughout Japan), and in 1930 established the Taito Shodoin (a group of calligraphers).
sen.cmt: 泰東書道院に(a group of calligraphers) を追記しました。

sen.j: 戦後は日本書道美術院創立に尽力し、1947年日本美術展覧会に五科〈書部門〉を設置することに力を尽くした。
sen.e: After the War, he made every effort to found the Nihon Shodo Bijutsuin and in 1947 devoted himself to set up the fifth department (Calligraphy) in The Japan Fine Arts Exhibition.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外対処」「五科」＝「the fifth department」は、下記サイトを参考にしました。http://www.nitten.or.jp/english/index.html
sen.e: After the War, he made every effort to found the Nihon Shodo Bijutsuin (Japan Calligraphy Art Academy) and in 1947 devoted himself to set up the fifth department (Calligraphy) in The Japan Fine Arts Exhibition.
sen.cmt: added content in parenthesis for "Nihon Shodo Bijutsuin"
sen.e: After the War, he made every effort to found the Nihon Shodo Bijutsuin (Japan Calligraphy Art Academy) and in 1947 devoted himself to set up the fifth department (Calligraphy) in The Japan Fine Arts Exhibition.

sen.j: 1947年（昭和22年）に芸術院の会員となり、62年天台宗大僧正、1967年〈昭和42年）には文化功労者に選ばれた。
sen.e: He became a member of The Japan Art Academy in 1947, Daisojo (a Buddhist priest of the highest order) of Tendai Sect in 1962 and was selected as a Bunkakorosha (Person of Cultural Merits) in 1967.

He became a member of The Japan Art Academy in 1947, and was selected to be a Daisojo (a Buddhist priest of the highest order) of the Tendai sect in 1962 and a Bunkakorosha (Person of Cultural Merits) in 1967.
sen.cmt: Changed the sentence so that he was "selected" as both Daisojo and Bunkakorosha since this was not clear in the first translation (I believe this corresponds to the Japanese with the 「、」 placement)
sen.e: He became a member of The Japan Art Academy in 1947, and was selected to be a Daisojo (a Buddhist priest of the highest order) of the Tendai sect in 1962 and a Bunkakorosha (Person of Cultural Merits) in 1967.
